title: Vietnam War in film
data: The story features Woo Viet , who wants to leave his country , Vietnam , behind and start over in the United States
The Fall of Saigon and its aftermath

The Killing Fields is a 1984 British biographical drama film about the Khmer Rouge regime in Cambodia , which is based on the experiences of two journalists : Cambodian Dith Pran and American Sydney Schanberg

Judith , an Australian photojournalist ( Greta Scacchi ) , leaves her family to cover the story of Vietnamese boat people in a Malaysian refugee camp . There she befriends Minou , a Vietnamese streetwalker ( Joan Chen ) , who has married a diplomat and together they try to bring awareness to the terrible conditions suffered by the people there
The experiences of Vietnamese refugees in the United States immediately following the end of the war
A Vietnamese boy ( Damien Nguyen ) goes to the US to search for his father , an American ex-soldier
Sống trong sợ hãi ( Living in Fear )

A Vietnamese farmer is supporting two families after the end of the war - one in the north , which he abandoned after fleeing during the war , and his new family in the south . To get enough money he sets on to re-cultivate a field full of mines . His life and psyche is changing while he removes each mine by himself
Vietnamese experience of post-war re-education camps and life as refugees
The Gate ( French : Le Temps des aveux ) is a 2014 French-Belgian-Cambodian drama film directed by Régis Wargnier , based on the books by François Bizot
First They Killed My Father ( film )

First They Killed My Father ( Khmer : មុនដំបូងខ្មែរក្រហមសម្លាប់ប៉ារបស់ខ្ញុំ Moun dambaung Khmer Krahm samleab ba robsa khnhom ) is a 2017 Cambodian-American Khmer biographical historical thriller film directed by Angelina Jolie and written by Jolie and Loung Ung , based on Ung 's memoir of the same name . Set in 1975 , the film depicts 7-year-old Ung who is forced to be trained as a child soldier while her siblings are sent to labor camps during the Communist Khmer Rouge regime
